title: 109_s2573
content: The Act titled "Reverse the Raid on Student Aid Act of 2006" includes interest rate reductions. The "Reverse the Raid on Student Aid Act of 2006" includes interest rate reductions for FFEL and Direct Loans. FFEL interest rates are reduced from 6.8% to 3.4% except for loans made after July 1, 2006, which will have a 6.8% interest rate. Direct Loans interest rates are reduced from 8.5% to 4.25%. The "Reverse the Raid on Student Aid Act of 2006" reduces interest rates for FFEL and Direct Loans. FFEL rates drop from 6.8% to 3.4%, except for loans after July 1, 2006, which will have a 6.8% rate. Direct Loans rates decrease from 8.5% to 4.25%. SEC. 3. FEDERAL PELL GRANT AWARDS. Section 401 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant award amounts for academic years from 2007-2012. Subsection (g) is removed, and subsections (h), (i), and (j) are redesignated. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant award amounts for academic years 2007-2011. Subsections are redesignated and funds are authorized and appropriated for each academic year. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to adjust Pell Grant award amounts for academic years 2010-2011 and beyond, with maximum award amounts increasing annually based on the Consumer Price Index. SEC. 4. IN-SCHOOL CONSOLIDATION. Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 regarding repayment commencement for student loans. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATIVE ACCOUNT FOR DIRECT LOAN PROGRAM. Amends the Act to allocate funds for administrative expenses. The Secretary is allocated funds for administrative expenses, including costs for direct student loan programs and account maintenance fees to guaranty agencies under part B. The funds available are not to exceed $904,000,000 in fiscal year 2007, increasing annually until reaching $1,106,000,000 in fiscal year 2012. Account maintenance fees are paid quarterly and deposited in the Agency Operating Fund. The Secretary can carry over funds to the next fiscal year. Fees payable to guaranty agencies should not exceed 0.10 percent of the original loan amount. The Secretary must justify budget expenditures to Congress. The Secretary must justify budget expenditures to Congress, including activities and costs planned for the budget year and projections for remaining years. SEC. 6. SINGLE HOLDER RULE. Amendment to section 428C(b)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 regarding consolidation selection.
